reviews.text: If you are looking for a "full service" four star hotel as you would find in a large city, this is not for you. If you are looking for a hotel that perfectly matches the informality and friendliness of Chamonix, then L'Hôtel de L'Arve is probably going to appeal to you. It is a relatively small hotel and has a small staff (the staff that serves the breakfast is the same staff that cleans the rooms). Its location is ideal - not on the main street but only a few feet down a private drive and right on the river - a 5-minute walk to the center of town. Nearby is a complex where you have a laundromat, restaurants, shops, a grocery store, and a hotel that caters to tour groups. I would recommend that you request a room that faces Mont Blanc - not only for the view but also for the riverside location - the sound of the running river and the cool breeze from the glacial stream make sleeping just more pleasant! The breakfast is good - boil your own eggs, choose from a variety of breads and croissants, juices, cereals, cheese and cold cuts plates, yoghurt - something to please everybody. There is also Internet access available just off the lobby.

Hotel de L'arve, Chamonix
reviews.text: We payed 106 euro's for a superior room (with an extra sofa and sufficient space, view on Arve river and mountains) plus 10 euro's p.p. for a satisfying breakfast.

Booked 1 nights stay at Hotel de l'Arve while on route to Tuscany. Booked the hotel in April and specifed that we wanted a double room, including a double bed ,even confirmed this with a telephone call. Europe hotels do seem to pass off two singles pushed together as a "double" which is so annoying! Anyway, arrived to find that we had been given a twin room. Was then informed that the hotel was full and they could nothing about it. Attitude of the staff was of the "shrugg of the shoulders" type and offered nothing in the way of compensation. The rooms are very small, not sure I stay here as a skiing base, on the basis that I could just about fit my wash bag and change of clothes in the very small room. Location good, although parking was a bit tight. Our room over looked the mont blanc, beautifal even in June. Also room was right on the river, and having the door open at night while sleeping wasn't great, sounded like we might have well been white water rafting!! Great for some sleepers, not for me though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in April of 2008...it was not our first choice - that was a different property but their prices were much higher for the Friday and Saturday nights we were going to be there, so we had to change to the Hotel de L'Arve...location is fantastic - right in the heart of Chamonix...the room was 'okay'. Kind of old feeling, the bed was very uncomfortable with a thin, old blanket. This wouldn't have been too much of a problem but there must have been a problem with the plumbing in our room - it smelled absolutely horrific so we had to sleep with the windows open and therefore were freezing. We mentioned the smell, something was done but it never fully was gone (but it got better). Breakfast was pretty good - good selection for the buffet and the dining area was nice.
